timeline.message:
Fix negative estimatedCompressionRatio issue

There are cases that currentEstimation is smaller than
COMPRESSION_RATIO_IMPROVING_STEP and it will get negative
estimatedCompressionRatio,which leads to misjudgment
about if there is no room and MESSAGE_TOO_LARGE might occur.

Change-Id: I0932a2a6ca669f673ab5d862d3fe7b2bb6d96ff6
Signed-off-by: Jiamei Xie <jiamei.xie@arm.com>

Fix negative estimatedCompressionRatio issue

There are cases that currentEstimation is smaller than
COMPRESSION_RATIO_IMPROVING_STEP and it will get negative
estimatedCompressionRatio,which leads to misjudgment
about if there is no room and MESSAGE_TOO_LARGE might occur.

Change-Id: I0932a2a6ca669f673ab5d862d3fe7b2bb6d96ff6
Signed-off-by: Jiamei Xie <jiamei.xie@arm.com>
Merge branch 'trunk' of https://github.com/apache/kafka into negative

timeline.bodyText: It seems like we are duplicating a lot of the logic of the code in this comment. This is likely to get stale over time. Can we make the comment more concise and refer to the non test code for more detail?
timeline.author: ijuma

timeline.bodyText: It seems that expected is always the same as observed? If so, why do we have 3 parameters instead of 2?
timeline.author: ijuma

timeline.bodyText: If we use a List, we should be able to simplify the logic below by using an enhanced for loop.
timeline.author: ijuma
